newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Hungary cen bank says cuts base rate to 24.50 pct.
newsitem.headline: Hungary cen bank says cuts base rate to 24.50 pct.

text.p: The National Bank of Hungary (NBH) said on Friday it will cut the base rate to an annual 24.50 percent from the current 25.50 percent, effective September 1.
"The reduction of the base rate is the result of the decline of inflation," the NBH said in a statement.
The NBH will also cut the rediscount rate for bills up to 90 days to maturity, to an annual 23.10 percent from 24.00 percent.
With the base rate cut, interest rates on financial institutions' refinancing loans for more than a year to maturity will fall to an annual 24.50 percent from 25.50 percent.
The interest rate on project financing loans provided against foreign exchange deposits will fall to 24.50 percent from 25.50 percent, it said.
Rates on loans to refinance so-called "Start" and "Japanese" credits, calculated as 75 percent of the central bank's base rate, will drop to 18.375 percent from 19.125 percent.
